data.title: Not worth the money
data.text: Basically a building with each room featuring similar household toys grouped together with a few larger-scale backdrops. My 4 year-old daughter didn't learn anything and definitely was not fascinated. Would only recommend for families with young toddlers - those who recently learned to walk and are entertained with their new-found freedom.

data.title: Wisconsinites visiting
data.text: My kids loved it 9yrs old-23 mths old!  We stayed for 3 hrs.  Lots of dressup and imagination play. It was setup like a city.  The staff was super friendly too!

data.title: Wonderful for the little ones
data.text: A tiny town for our tiny humans - little ones love this place and moms and dads grin from ear to ear as they explore and giggle with delight.

data.title: Playhouse
data.text:
The kids had fun playing but doubt they learned anything from the experience . ,Vienna,,lingcod scathing nnmkllmvcsvkllrdchgkbkukhvhgvjbjkkjnljnklj

data.title: Children's Delight
data.text: This is a wonderful place for children. Located downtown, not far from the public library and center of downtown, this is a hidden jewel for children and adults to enjoy. Children will definitely be fascinated and most of all have plenty of fun. This is a child's place and they will enjoy meeting others and becoming fascinated at Fascinate-U Children's Museum

data.title: Great place to take your kids.
data.text: I have taken my grandchildren to this museum. It is a very informative interaction place. My grandchildren loved it. I had to drag them away. They have different little places for real life experiences like a miniature bank, post office, courtroom, grocery store, class room, dress up room, 911 operator station, ambulance, firehouse, news station, army station, and more. They even have a phone booth, that my grandchildren have never seen. A dentist station and a er station. They really enjoyed playing in each of the places and I got tons of pictures.

data.title: Nice morning event with grandchildren
data.text: Had the pleasure of visiting the children's museum.  It was a very nice morning with the grandchildren enjoying themselves with the activities.  Downstairs were many activities for the kids to play in or with.  However, upstairs was a train museum that seemed to take of a lot of room in the facility and while interesting...it did not hold the interest of a 5 and 2 year old.  It seems a rather dated activity for the modern era youth.  Overall we had a nice time at the museum, however, it seems to be showing its age with many of the activities not having all their pieces to them or very mediocre for a child activity.

data.title: Great!
data.text: Great place for children to do all kinds of hands on activities! Try to go when no school field trips are planned.

data.title: Worth a visit
data.text: This museum is very small and a bit dated but it still can provide lots of fun for the kids.  The biggest perk is that it's not crowded at all and thus a great "starter" museum for little kids to visit before going to some of the larger children's museums in other cities.  My girls loved the grocery store and the media area.  The Toddler Room is also nice for the little ones.  If possible, try to visit on one of the Saturdays that the upstairs model train display is open.

data.title: It's an Average place for kids
data.text: This museum is ok, the price is what doesn't make it worth it. The museum contents are old, outdated and it's obvious not much money goes into it.

data.title: So much fun for 5 and under
data.text: This place is tons of fun, extremely cheap cost, it may not be fancy to adults but every kids loves it. They get to play dentist, firefighter, news anchor and lots of other things. Great for a rainy day.

data.title: Angelina's Review
data.text: I've been living in Fayetteville for 15 years and never been to Fascinate U, but last year I took my grand daughter there. I believe I was more "Fascinated" than she was. I loved all the miniature things they had there for the kids. Being there took me back to my childhood days and, my grand daughter just loved it. This is a wonderful place to bring children of all ages and adults too.

data.title: Needs to be updated and cleaned
data.text: I have been forced to go here for more than one birthday party, otherwise, I would never let my kids go here. All of the "toys" are outdated. Everything seems dirty and old. I have been to this museum over the course of about five years and absolutely nothing has changed. It's hard to believe that it's still open.

data.title: Kids Liked It
data.text: Let me get this out of the way first...my family was in town visiting and we went here on a rainy day so they could exert some energy and they had a blast. A blast! They wanted to go back BUT, I won't take them. The place seems like it hasn't been sanitized, wiped down, cleaned in weeks and in my mind as much traffic that goes through there, that should be happening throughout the day. The price was good, the gift shop was nice but I just felt like the place could be updated and cleaned.

data.title: Fun for Children!
data.text: This is my go-to place when I'm babysitting children ages 10 and under. It's extremely fun for the kids, because they get to pay dress up and grocery store/mailman/cop/etc., but it does charge for entry. I don't know why they don't update some of the toys, because I remember these toys when I was playing here 10+ years ago! This places needs an update, but it's still fun for the kids because they don't know that the toys are so old. All in all, it's a fun place for kids and their imagination!

data.title: Fun Time for all
data.text: This is a child's interactive site that will keep both child and adult on the move. My nephew asked for a repeat visit.

data.title: Fun for my daughter.
data.text: My daughter has lots of fun here, but why do I have to pay to get in? The dress up stage is nice, with lots of different things to try on, the news broadcast is really cool and the grocery store is a lot of fun. Like most things in Fayetteville there are things that need to be fixed/replaced. Overall this is a nice place to take your child for an afternoon of fun.

data.title: Fun Museum for children
data.text:
This is a fun little children's museum hidden downtown.  It is great for younger aged children, 10 and under.  
They also have other opportunities for children to be involved in extra-curricular activities, such as weekly art classes.  
The staff is friendly and helpful!

data.title: Great Place to Visit With Your Little One
data.text: Took my 3 year old granddaughter here on a recent trip to Fayetteville and she had a ball!!!  The museum is a little dated and some of the electronic activities needed to be fixed, but she barely noticed as there were more than enough other attractions to keep her busy and happy. Have taken her to the children's touch-me museum in Philadelphia and she was a little overwhelmed.  Fascinate-U is a little more low-tech but a bit more toddler-friendly.  Great place to visit with your little one in Fayetteville.

data.title: Fun for kids from 2 to 82
data.text:
Fascinate museum is 180 degrees different than most museums.  The norm is to look but do NOT touch.  This museum not only allows visitors to pick up and play with its equipment, but encourages it.  Practically nothing is breakable so parents can sit back and enjoy their children's creativity.
Each room and section of the museum is different and inviting.
I highly recommend Fascinate U Museum to Homeschooling families.  It allows the whole family to interact with topics that they be studying at the moment.
The museum is a great "rainy day" trip for young families.
Parking is no problem.  There are additional museums within walking distance from this museum.  Pack a picnic lunch and make a full day of fun/education.
